summary: Share represents a concept central to innovation and collaboration. It emphasizes the importance of open knowledge exchange in fostering creativity and progress. This idea is exemplified in the course "Practice Innovation," which highlights sharing as a key component of the innovative process. By encouraging generous sharing of ideas, tools, and experiences, individuals and organizations can create an environment conducive to breakthrough thinking and problem-solving. Sharing not only disseminates knowledge but also builds trust, strengthens leadership, and empowers others, ultimately driving collective growth and advancement in various fields such as art, music, film, coding, and AI.
excerpt: To practice innovation, one should think strategically, act tactically, use tools creatively, generate diversity, and share generously. This approach combines big-picture thinking with practical action, encouraging unconventional tool use.
